channel.title: My armour
channel.description:
Okay so here's the deal.
I fixed things and re-arranged the sprite numbers in correct order, added some customs, they worked. Added my 2h, chain, girls plate. BUT the girls plates fucked, like after the chain it stuffs up.. I'm not sure what the problem is about this, i tried changing it a few, still shows up invisible or other random shit like head movements, face changes, weild of like a iron helmet in higher sprite numbers etc.
This is the first image, with my chain working.. [URL=http://img200.imageshack.us/i/dudewdf.jpg/][IMG]http://img200.imageshack.us/img200/4640/dudewdf.jpg[/img][/URL] [URL=http://g.imageshack.us/img200/dudewdf.jpg/1/][IMG]http://img200.imageshack.us/img200/dudewdf.jpg/1/w510.png[/img][/URL]
This is the next image, with me wearing my girls plate.. [URL=http://img33.imageshack.us/i/dudewtf.jpg/][IMG]http://img33.imageshack.us/img33/7025/dudewtf.jpg[/img][/URL] [URL=http://g.imageshack.us/img33/dudewtf.jpg/1/][IMG]http://img33.imageshack.us/img33/dudewtf.jpg/1/w504.png[/img][/URL]
This is my Chain Below, im pretty sure.. [code] <entry> <int>1330</int> <ItemWieldableDef> <sprite>255</sprite> <type>64</type> <wieldPos>6</wieldPos> <armourPoints>65</armourPoints> <weaponAimPoints>0</weaponAimPoints> <weaponPowerPoints>0</weaponPowerPoints> <magicPoints>0</magicPoints> <prayerPoints>0</prayerPoints> <rangePoints>0</rangePoints> <requiredStats> <entry> <int>1</int> <int>40</int> </entry> </requiredStats> <femaleOnly>false</femaleOnly> </ItemWieldableDef> </entry> [/code] This is my female plate below, im pretty sure.. [code] <entry> <int>1331</int> <ItemWieldableDef> <sprite>256</sprite> <type>322</type> <wieldPos>1</wieldPos> <armourPoints>40</armourPoints> <weaponAimPoints>0</weaponAimPoints> <weaponPowerPoints>0</weaponPowerPoints> <magicPoints>0</magicPoints> <prayerPoints>0</prayerPoints> <rangePoints>0</rangePoints> <requiredStats> <entry> <int>1</int> <int>10</int> </entry> </requiredStats> <femaleOnly>true</femaleOnly> </ItemWieldableDef> </entry> [/code]
If anyone can help me, via msn, forums, teamview please help us out :D

item.title: My armour
item.dc:creator: @bonzakid bonzakid
item.description:
@bonzakid wrote:

Or you could always change the data-type being used to for instance a short (which is 2 bytes). Well, I guess this is only necessary if you already use pretty much all 256 combinations for a byte. And if you actually do use all 256 combinations, then this is the only alternative.

And where could you change this if there is a such way?

Read full topic

just give us a honk when ur free lol.

item.title: My armour
item.dc:creator: @bonzakid bonzakid
item.description:
@bonzakid wrote:

Im Kevin:

“So 256 is one value to high” 256 - 1 = 255

I already have 255 as a sprite… As i said… IT would just turn it to that look… Gay.

Read full topic

item.title: My armour
item.dc:creator: @bonzakid bonzakid
item.description:
@bonzakid wrote:

[quote=“object, post:1, topic:287208”]Your problem, bonzakid, lies in the following part of your XML-file:

<sprite>256</sprite>

As you might know, a byte can only contain 256 different values; namely -127 to 128 (inclusive) for a signed byte and 0 to 255 (inclusive) for an unsigned byte. So, 256 is 1 value too high… And when you use a byte with a value higher than the maximum value, as in this case, it overflows, and starts over again (in a cyclic pattern).[/quote]
Okay thanks for explaining, so i guess i’d change it to 0? And it will start the cycle over again?

Read full topic

item.title: My armour
item.dc:creator: @bonzakid bonzakid
item.description:
@bonzakid wrote:

Okay so here’s the deal.

I fixed things and re-arranged the sprite numbers in correct order, added some customs, they worked. Added my 2h, chain, girls plate. BUT the girls plates fucked, like after the chain it stuffs up…
I’m not sure what the problem is about this, i tried changing it a few, still shows up invisible or other random shit like head movements, face changes, weild of like a iron helmet in higher sprite numbers etc.

This is the first image, with my chain working…

This is the next image, with me wearing my girls plate…

This is my Chain Below, im pretty sure…

<entry>
		<int>1330</int>
		<ItemWieldableDef>
			<sprite>255</sprite>
			<type>64</type>
			<wieldPos>6</wieldPos>
			<armourPoints>65</armourPoints>
			<weaponAimPoints>0</weaponAimPoints>
			<weaponPowerPoints>0</weaponPowerPoints>
			<magicPoints>0</magicPoints>
			<prayerPoints>0</prayerPoints>
			<rangePoints>0</rangePoints>
			<requiredStats>
				<entry>
					<int>1</int>
					<int>40</int>
				</entry>
			</requiredStats>
			<femaleOnly>false</femaleOnly>
		</ItemWieldableDef>
	</entry>

This is my female plate below, im pretty sure…

	<entry>
		<int>1331</int>
		<ItemWieldableDef>
			<sprite>256</sprite>
			<type>322</type>
			<wieldPos>1</wieldPos>
			<armourPoints>40</armourPoints>
			<weaponAimPoints>0</weaponAimPoints>
			<weaponPowerPoints>0</weaponPowerPoints>
			<magicPoints>0</magicPoints>
			<prayerPoints>0</prayerPoints>
			<rangePoints>0</rangePoints>
			<requiredStats>
				<entry>
					<int>1</int>
					<int>10</int>
				</entry>
			</requiredStats>
			<femaleOnly>true</femaleOnly>
		</ItemWieldableDef>
	</entry>

If anyone can help me, via msn, forums, teamview please help us out

Read full topic
